decks.notes: This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly applying pressure to the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and removal spells. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while simultaneously presenting a clock that forces them to react. The deck also includes some disruptive elements like Duress and Anoint with Affliction to disrupt the opponent's hand and game plan. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive and aggressive, taking advantage of its powerful threats to close out the game quickly.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and disruptive spells to apply pressure on the opponent and control the board. By playing powerful threats like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition alongside ramp creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, the deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and maintain tempo advantage. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben serves as a disruptive force against opponent's spells, while cards like Collected Company provide card advantage and flexibility. With a mix of aggression and disruption, the Selesnya Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its efficient threats and keep them on the back foot.

The deck focuses on utilizing Transmogrify to quickly and efficiently combo out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Reckoner Bankbuster. It also includes disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to control the game and protect the combo. With a versatile mix of removal, card draw, and powerful threats, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its synergistic strategy and take control of the game with its combo potential.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and put pressure on the opponent. It includes a mix of card draw, burn spells, and cheap cantrips to help dig for key pieces. The goal is to use spells to trigger the Phoenix's ability and bring it back from the graveyard for repeated attacks. The deck also includes some disruptive elements like Spell Pierce and Brazen Borrower to control the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive human creatures such as Thalia's Lieutenant, Adeline, Resplendent Cathar, and Coppercoat Vanguard. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures while utilizing cards like Get Lost to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base includes lands that help cast the diverse range of creatures smoothly, allowing for a consistent and powerful aggro strategy aimed at reducing the opponent's life total as quickly as possible.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through the use of hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize, removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, and powerful creature threats like Unstoppable Slasher and Bloodletter of Aclazotz. By keeping the opponent on the back foot with constant disruption and removal, the deck aims to grind out value and eventually outvalue the opponent with card advantage and powerful threats like Sheoldred's Edict and Graveyard Trespasser.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice synergies and efficient removal spells to control the board while also generating card advantage with cards like Trail of Crumbs and Cache Grab. The deck also features powerful threats like Tyvar, Jubilant Brawler and Ygra, Eater of All to close out the game quickly. The inclusion of Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven allows for recurring value and the ability to drain the opponent's life total. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure the victory.

The deck revolves around using counterspells, removal, and card advantage to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It focuses on denying the opponent's threats while drawing into more answers and win conditions. The deck includes a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw effects to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain control of the board. The win conditions include powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils, as well as Shark Typhoon for a late-game threat. The mana base is designed to support the control game plan with utility lands and a mix of basic lands.
